title: UPDATE: 3-year-old Gaston child dies after accidental shooting on Monday
content:
LEXINGTON COUNTY, SC The Lexington County Sheriff’s Department tweeted Saturday night that the 3-year-old Gaston girl who shot herself with a handgun on Monday has died.
The announcement came from sheriff’s department public information officer Capt. Adam Myrick.
3-year-old girl who accidentally shot herself Monday has died.Our investigation is ongoing.@wis10 @WLTX @wachfox @abc_columbia @thestate
— Lexington Sheriff (@LCSD_News) July 24, 2016
The Major Crimes Unit from the Lexington County Sheriff’s Department continues its investigation into the Monday incident .
Deputies responded to the accidental shooting on the 2400 block of Glenn Road, in the Gaston area, according to Myrick, who provided limited information at the time because he said the sheriff’s department was still investigating the incident.
Investigators are trying to determine how the 3-year-old girl got the handgun, said Myrick.
When asked if any arrests had been made – or were forthcoming – Capt. Myrick said, “We are not currently seeking any persons of interest related to the incident.”
